project.name: Ruby
project.description: This project provides support for the Ruby programming language.

longdescription.p: The Ruby project maintains packages for Ruby implementations, libraries and development tools.
This project also maintains the RubyGems package, the de facto standard for packaging Ruby projects. Many Ruby packages currently in the Portage tree use this mechanism for installing.
Highlighted packages include Rake, Ruby on Rails, Capistrano, and RSpec, to name a few.

job.details: General ruby package maintainer to help out managing packages in the herd. Revision bumping, bug filing/fixing, updating ebuilds per eclass or syntax changes, etc. This involves a mix of gem and source based ebuilds.
job.requirements: Experience with ruby on Linux, ideally Gentoo. Knowledge of the gem repository system and its supporting software and experience with building ruby software using setup.rb and its many incarnations.

job.details: Ruby core package maintainer to help out with the core ruby packages (dev-lang/ruby and dev-ruby/rubygems). Revision bumping, handling security bugs, patching packages to play nice with Gentoo, following upstream to handle changes and updates in a timely manner.
job.requirements: Experience with ruby on Linux, ideally Gentoo. Knowledge of C and ruby. Experience with patching software.

task.name: Ruby 1.9
task.description: Support for all Ruby packages with 1.9

longdescription.p:
Ruby 1.9.1 is going to be the first stable release of Ruby 1.9, to be released in January 2009.
Our infrastructure is currently being updated, so we should have ebuilds quite soon after release.

milestone.description: Support RubyGems being installed for multiple slots of Ruby
Have a working way to switch default symlinks. Done with eselect-ruby.
Verify USE_RUBY status for all packages in the tree

longdescription.p: While packaging directly from gems is very convenient, it does have some draw backs, such as not being able to readily patch and not being able to run unit tests. Generating gems from source would address both these issues.

task.name: Project "Gemtoo": gem install replacement
task.description: Create a better way to install gems

longdescription.p: While rubygems is a nice way for platforms without any package management (like Mac OS X or Windows), it conflicts with the Gentoo way of installing things.

milestone.description: Adapt the gem install process to our ebuild stages
